title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent in Westwood, Los Angeles

content.rendered:
Located in California, Westwood is the ideal choice for students and recent grads, as well as young business professionals. Planning a move to this history-rich neighborhood? The museums here are not to be missed! Before making the big move, here’s your neighborhood guide with all the key info you’ll need. Keep it handy for details on average rent and restaurants in Westwood. Certainly, this neighborhood guide will make your search for rooms for rent in Westwood, Los Angeles much easier.

Where is Westwood?

Settled on Wilshire Blvd., Westwood is nestled among some of L.A.’s wealthiest neighborhoods. To the north, you’ll find Bel Air and to the south, there’s Century City. On the west lies Brentwood and on the east, there’s Beverly Hills. It’s now attracting a huge number of young families and professionals due to the comparatively reasonable average rent in Westwood than its surrounding neighborhoods.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Los Angeles

Find Rooms For Rent in Westwood

Find A Room For Rent Westwood, LA

With over 40,000 students, UCLA’s campus dominates Westwood and housing in the area is split into two different regions. The west side offers mid-rise and high-rise apartment buildings that house students in an exciting and stimulating environment. The east side, on the other hand, tends to have single-family homes with prices rising the further north you go.

Average Rent in Westwood, LA

Westwood is a good choice for families because it has a lot of child-friendly features, such as large parks and interactive play places. This neighborhood has a diverse population of individuals from various age groups and backgrounds. Furthermore, you can easily find a roommate to help you save money on your basic living expenses. Here is the current average rent in Westwood, LA:

Is Westwood safe?

If you’re looking for a safe neighborhood in Los Angeles, you can’t go wrong with Westwood. Compared to other areas of LA, this is a very safe place to live. Here are a few apps that provide useful neighborhood knowledge to make the process of finding rooms for rent in Westwood hassle-free. Browse through them before your visit and get access to vital information — for free!

Related: Pet-Friendly Decor for Your Los Angeles Apartment

  • AreaVibes: This tool provides a livability score based on your Zip Code. The livability score uses an algorithm to weigh amenities, cost of living, safety rates, education, employment, housing, and weather.
  • Trulia: This site does a great job of helping you find the average rent and best restaurants in Westwood. Also, it gives you reviews from local residents, details on groceries, safety, and shopping. It’s an essential app to refer to while looking for rooms for rent in Westwood, California.
  • Hotline Numbers: 911 and 311 are the two helpful numbers LA residents use to contact the emergency services. 311 is a type of residents’ hotline that you can call to report issues like abandoned vehicles, road repairs, noise complaints, and graffiti. By adding a second channel for residents to report problems, 911 operators are free to address emergencies.

Public Transit in Westwood

1. Walkability

This neighborhood is the 47th most walkable neighborhood in LA with a walk score of 69. It’s known as a pedestrian-friendly neighborhood and you can walk to most of the major local attractions. Also, when you live in Westwood your daily errands don’t require a car as you can easily get them done by foot.

2. Roads & Traffic

This area of LA has a light flow of traffic, which is an advantage in a city known for its hustle and bustle. Check out the Traffic Map before starting your journey.

3. Nearby Train Stations

Familiarizing yourself with transit options can help save time while looking for rooms for rent in Westwood. Amtrak trains and connecting buses reach more than 150 destinations in the Golden State, including top cities such as San Diego, Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, San Francisco, and Sacramento.

Related: Roomi Picks: Must-Read Books About Los Angeles

4. Nearby Bus Stops

The bus line 4 has routes that pass through the neighborhood and will help you reach any destination around the city.

Restaurants in Westwood

You’re bound to work up an appetite while you’re out and about looking for rooms for rent in Westwood. So, don’t forget to explore some of the many eateries in the neighborhood. Here are a few of our top picks:

1. Tantardino’s

Expect delicious food including great dinner salads with crispy greens and plenty of dressing at Tantardino’s. This place comes among the most spectacular restaurants in Westwood for its friendly service.

Website

2. 800 Degrees Pizza

800 Degrees combines a time-honed method with excellent ingredients to make classic Neapolitan pizza named after the temperature required to make it. This place’s authentic Italian cuisine makes it one of the greatest restaurants in Westwood – if not all of California.

Website

3. Red Onion Grill

If you’re looking for scrumptious steaks, there aren’t many restaurants in Westwood that can compare to this one. You can’t go wrong with anything here, really. They also make excellent mixed cocktails, fresh pasta, and tasty sausage.

Website

Related: A Basic Guide On Living With Roommates In LA

Parks in Westwood

In addition to a variety of rooms for rent in Westwood, the neighborhood also offers attractive outdoor areas. Here you’ll find gorgeous green spaces overlooking the sights of the city.

  • Clear Creek Park: This tree-filled city park is a beautiful place to stop for a picnic and for kids to play in the playground.
  • George Young Park: This is the perfect spot to unwind with children after a day’s search for rooms for rent in Westwood.
  • Wingate Park: Set in a wooded area, it offers a cabin stay where you can take a break from the city life. Surrounded by huge pine trees and places for bonfires, this camp is a peaceful place to enjoy nature in comfort.

Related: Keeping Up With Googie: So-Cal’s Signature Style

Museums in Westwood

1. Hammer Museum

The Hammer Museum provides something for every art enthusiast, with a diverse range of exhibits, films, and discussions. The museum also gives free entry to the general public, making a visit to the Hammer all the more appealing.

2. The Fowler

Having museums near potential rooms for rent in Westwood is a must if you’re a history buff! This internationally famous museum, located in the center of UCLA’s campus, focuses on works of art from Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The Fowler is ideal for anyone interested in world arts and culture. The museum is open to the public for free.

3. The Planetarium

Located in the university’s South Campus area, the Planetarium hosts free Wednesday evening lectures, as well as planetarium presentations. If you’re looking for museums in Westwood that offer telescope gazing, this place won’t disappoint!

With this, we’ve come to the end of our neighborhood guide to Westwood. Happy moving!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Westwood? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
